column4: hmm... Can anyone help me out, Im trying to get OpenOffice Base to work with either ODBC or JDBC ... Im not sure how to set them up and how to create a db on it
I did this a while ago, following instructions I found on the web. Would it help if I found that URL for you?
okay, two minutes.
can't find it -- I think the page has vanished. Perhaps http://kienlein.com/pages/mysql-jdbc-howto-de.html will help, though.
thanks a lot!
it was the windows Tutorial you sent me the link to... but ive found the one for Linux in english http://kienlein.com/pages/mysql-jdbc-howto-en.html (just in case youd like to know ;-))
thanks.
no, you can save your /home and other data files.
Yeah, the data is portable of course, but take xchat, could I keep the configuration... or for example evolution setup (accounts)
yes.
even things you've configured system-wide in /etc/ should be salvageable.
after all, most of those are just text files.
are they indifferent as to 64/32 bit enviroment?
yes
at least I'm not aware of any exceptions.
I can tell you where it's documented :)
there is a package called grub-doc. If you install this and run 'info grub', you'll eventually find step-by-step instructions for making a grub floppy.
I'm dodging my own problems. :)
join a channel where people that can help you are dodging their problems ;-)
have you got a suggestion? I need someone knowledgeable in nuclear magnetic resonance.
how about #ubuntu-offtopic ?
I've thought about it. :)
